components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.description:
Reopening, after further investigation I do not think this is a dup  of EUCA-11465. This is not consistent in CI, so could be a QA issue (ie  an existing dhcp server may be competing for ports/resources on the CC, etc..). 
The following tests appear to fail because the VM was unable to DHCP an address within the 120 second timeout...


http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/eutester-test-bfebs/6093/parsed_console/
BFEBS stop start
Failed to DHCP an address....
{code}
[2015-10-09 14:50:56,405] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Attempting to get console output from: Instance:i-ebecbb00
[2015-10-09 14:50:56,593] [i-ebecbb00] [DEBUG]: Console ci-info 'cloud-init start-local running: Fri, 09 Oct 2015 07:39:43 +0000. up 1.38 seconds':
[2015-10-09 14:50:56,594] [i-ebecbb00] [DEBUG]: Console ci-info 'cloud-init-nonet waiting 120 seconds for a network device.':
[2015-10-09 14:50:56,594] [i-ebecbb00] [DEBUG]: Console ci-info 'cloud-init-nonet gave up waiting for a network device.':
[2015-10-09 14:50:56,594] [i-ebecbb00] [DEBUG]: Console ci-info 'ci-info: lo : 1 127.0.0.1 255.0.0.0 .':
[2015-10-09 14:50:56,594] [i-ebecbb00] [DEBUG]: Console ci-info 'ci-info: eth0 : 1 . . d0:0d:eb:ec:bb:00':
[2015-10-09 14:50:56,595] [i-ebecbb00] [DEBUG]: Was unable to gather debug for the node hosting this VM, err: list index out of range
[2015-10-09 14:50:56,595] [i-ebecbb00] [DEBUG]: Failed gathering ip addr list debug info from all nodes, err: "'NoneType' object has no attribute 'hostname'"
[2015-10-09 14:50:56,595] [i-ebecbb00] [DEBUG]: DONE Dumping Connection debug info for Instance:"i-ebecbb00"
{code}

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/eutester-test-instance-suite/6129/parsed_console/
instance suite
Failed to DHCP an address
{code}
[2015-10-09 15:03:16,437] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Attempting to get console output from: Instance:i-91e06a1b
[2015-10-09 15:03:16,621] [i-91e06a1b] [DEBUG]: Console ci-info 'cloud-init start-local running: Fri, 09 Oct 2015 07:52:09 +0000. up 1.36 seconds':
[2015-10-09 15:03:16,621] [i-91e06a1b] [DEBUG]: Console ci-info 'cloud-init-nonet waiting 120 seconds for a network device.':

[2015-10-09 15:03:16,622] [i-91e06a1b] [DEBUG]: Was unable to gather debug for the node hosting this VM, err: list index out of range
[2015-10-09 15:03:16,622] [i-91e06a1b] [DEBUG]: Failed gathering ip addr list debug info from all nodes, err: "'NoneType' object has no attribute 'hostname'"
[2015-10-09 15:03:16,622] [i-91e06a1b] [DEBUG]: DONE Dumping Connection debug info for Instance:"i-91e06a1b"
[2015-10-09 15:03:16,623] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Traceback (most recent call last):
{code}

EBS suite 
Failed to DHCP an address
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/eutester-test-ebs-suite/6047/parsed_console/
{code}
[2015-10-09 16:32:58,247] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Attempting to get console output from: Instance:i-35b4152d

Opening this to track CI failures to connect to VMs when running in Managed mode. 
I have made little effort to debug/root cause this, but  looking into this now and will update via this ticket. 
Thanks -M
fields.summary: Eucanetd detecting wrong mode.  VMs  failing to DHCP an address.

comments.body:
eucanetd.log on CC throughout entire test...

{code}
2349 2015-10-09 07:51:47  WARN | cannot complete pre-flight checks (ignore if local NC has not yet been registered), retrying
 2350 2015-10-09 07:51:48  WARN | cannot find global_network_info.xml state file in $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus or $EUCALYPTUS/var/run/eucalyptus yet.
 2351 2015-10-09 07:51:48  WARN | cannot complete pre-flight checks (ignore if local NC has not yet been registered), retrying
 2352 2015-10-09 07:51:49  WARN | cannot find global_network_info.xml state file in $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus or $EUCALYPTUS/var/run/eucalyptus yet.
 2353 2015-10-09 07:51:49  WARN | cannot complete pre-flight checks (ignore if local NC has not yet been registered), retrying
 2354 2015-10-09 07:51:50  WARN | cannot find global_network_info.xml state file in $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus or $EUCALYPTUS/var/run/eucalyptus yet.
 2355 2015-10-09 07:51:50  WARN | cannot complete pre-flight checks (ignore if local NC has not yet been registered), retrying
 2356 2015-10-09 07:51:51  WARN | cannot find global_network_info.xml state file in $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus or $EUCALYPTUS/var/run/eucalyptus yet.
 2357 2015-10-09 07:51:51  WARN | cannot complete pre-flight checks (ignore if local NC has not yet been registered), retrying
{code}

I was able to reproduce this manually on a working setup, may be a timing issue. 
Steps:
- I removed and replaced the eucalyptus.conf w/ a default on the CC
- I stopped all eucalytpus processes on the CC (eucalyptus-cc, eucalyptus-cloud, eucanetd)
- I removed /var/run/eucalyptus/eucanetd_global_network_info.xml
- eucanetd -f; killall eucanetd; killall dhcpd
- service eucanetd start
- Waited, nothing logged. After a 5-10 minutes I started up eucalyptus-cloud (for the co-located SC), looks like this might drop the global network xml? 
A new /var/run/eucalyptus/eucanetd_global_network_info.xml triggers the following logs to start above and continue. The xml does have the correct mode (managed), but eucanetd appears to think it's running in edge mode on an NC?
eucanetd log snippet
{code}
[root@g-08-09 eucalyptus]# fg
tail -F eucanetd.log



2015-10-09 21:55:43  INFO | update triggered due to file update (//var/run/eucalyptus/eucanetd_global_network_info.xml)
2015-10-09 21:55:43 ERROR | cannot retrieve cluster to which this NC belongs: check global network configuration
2015-10-09 21:55:43  WARN | eucanetd_read_latest_network failed, skipping update: check above errors for details
2015-10-09 21:55:44 ERROR | cannot retrieve cluster to which this NC belongs: check global network configuration
2015-10-09 21:55:44  WARN | eucanetd_read_latest_network failed, skipping update: check above errors for details

{code}



global_network_info.xml shown below...
{code}

[root@g-08-09 eucalyptus]# cat /var/run/eucalyptus/eucanetd_global_network_info.xml | xmllint --format -
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<network-data version="fb5aaef3">
  <configuration>
    <property name="mode">
      <value>MANAGED</value>
    </property>
    <property name="publicIps">
      <value>10.111.76.25</value>
      <value>10.111.76.26</value>
      <value>10.111.76.27</value>
      <value>10.111.76.28</value>
      <value>10.111.76.29</value>
      <value>10.111.76.30</value>
      <value>10.111.76.31</value>
      <value>10.111.76.32</value>
      <value>10.111.76.33</value>
      <value>10.111.76.42</value>
      <value>10.111.76.43</value>
      <value>10.111.76.44</value>
      <value>10.111.76.45</value>
      <value>10.111.76.46</value>
      <value>10.111.76.47</value>
      <value>10.111.76.48</value>
    </property>
    <property name="enabledCLCIp">
      <value>10.111.5.151</value>
    </property>
    <property name="instanceDNSDomain">
      <value>eucalyptus.internal</value>
    </property>
    <property name="instanceDNSServers">
      <value>10.111.1.117</value>
    </property>
    <property name="managedSubnet">
      <managedSubnet name="172.16.0.0">
        <property name="subnet">
          <value>172.16.0.0</value>
        </property>
        <property name="netmask">
          <value>255.255.0.0</value>
        </property>
        <property name="minVlan">
          <value>512</value>
        </property>
        <property name="maxVlan">
          <value>639</value>
        </property>
        <property name="segmentSize">
          <value>32</value>
        </property>
      </managedSubnet>
    </property>
    <property name="clusters"/>
  </configuration>
  <vpcs/>
  <instances>
    <instance name="i-692442ff">
      <ownerId>000407932775</ownerId>
      <macAddress>d0:0d:69:24:42:ff</macAddress>
      <publicIp>10.111.76.29</publicIp>
      <privateIp>172.16.71.207</privateIp>
      <networkInterfaces/>
      <securityGroups>
        <value>sg-b0005866</value>
      </securityGroups>
    </instance>
  </instances>
  <dhcpOptionSets/>
  <internetGateways/>
  <securityGroups>
    <securityGroup name="sg-b0005866">
      <ownerId>000407932775</ownerId>
      <rules/>
      <ingressRules/>
      <egressRules/>
    </securityGroup>
  </securityGroups>
</network-data>
{code}
Change in QA cookbook for not rebuilding code every cookbook run.

Title of the bug is incorrect (bad assumption on my part based upon the logged message). 
I believe the issue here is/was remote eucanetd was not getting the global xml when running on a remote CC. 
Thanks -M
